gr.forth.ics.graph
Interface Edge

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable, Tuple
public interface Edge
extends Tuple

An edge that connects two nodes. The incident nodes of an edge can neither be changed nor be reordered. This immutability means that is it safe for an edge to be shared between graphs.

See Also:
Graph, Node

Nested Class Summary
static class Edge.Orientation
          The kinds of relationship that two edges may have.

opposite

Node opposite(Node node)
Returns the opposite incident node of the specified node of this edge.

Returns:
  • n1(), if specified node is n2(),
  • n2(), if specified node is n1()
    Throws:
    RuntimeException - if the supplied node is neither n1() nor n2().

    getIntersection

    Node getIntersection(boolean startFromN1,
                     Edge other)
    Returns a node that both this edge and the supplied edge contain. If no such node exists, null is returned.

    Parameters:
    startFromN1 - if true, and both n1() and n2() are eligible, return n1(), or else return n2()
    other - the edge to be tested against this edge.
    Throws:
    NullArgumentException - when other is null

    areParallel

    boolean areParallel(Edge other)
    Returns true if the this edge and the supplied edge, are incident and form a directed path when put together.

    Throws:
    NullArgumentException - when other is null
    See Also:
    testOrientation(Edge)

    testOrientation

    Edge.Orientation testOrientation(Edge other)
    Tests the relative orientation of this edge towards a supplied edge. This is a finer-grained version of the areParallel method. If the two edges have no common node, or one of the edges are self-loops then Orientation.UNDEFINED is returned. If the edges form a directed path, then Orientation.SAME is returned. Finally, if nothing of this holds, that is, the edges are connected but do not form a directed path, Orientation.OPPOSITE is returned.

    Parameters:
    other - the other edge to test the orientation with
    Returns:
  • Orientation.UNDEFINED, if !isIncident(other) || isSelfLoop() || other.isSelfLoop(),
  • Orientation.SAME, if n2() == other.n1() || n1() == other.n2()
  • Orientation.OPPOSITE, if n1() == other.n1() || n2() == other.n2()
    Throws:
    NullArgumentException - when other is null

    • asPath

    Path asPath()
    Returns this edge as a Path.

    See Also:
    Path

    asPath

    Path asPath(Node headNode)
    Returns this edge as a Path, with the specified node as a head node.

    Parameters:
    headNode - a node that belongs to this edge, where the returned path will start from
    Returns:
    a path that starts at the specified node, with this edge as its only edge
    See Also:
    Path
